original: @88b # // rgya'i skad du /
analyzed: @88b # // rgya'i skad du /
translated: In Chinese:

original: g-yen ming gzhee'  cing li'i lun /
analyzed: g-yen ming gzhee'  cing li'i lun /
translated: Yuen-ming-ch√™ng-li-lun

original: bod skad du /üîΩtshad ma'i bstan bcos rigs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bod skad du / tshad ma'i bstan bcos rigs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba /
translated: In Tibetan:üîΩRigs-pa-la-'jug-pa-zhes-bya-ba-tshad-ma'i-bstan-bcos

original: 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dbyangs la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to ManjusriüîΩOne can prove and disprove

original: sgrub nus pa dang sun 'byin nus //
analyzed: sgrub nus pa dang sun 'byin nus //
translated: By means of apparent and real.üîΩOne can understand others

original: ltar snang bcas pas gzhan go byed //
analyzed: ltar snang bcas pas gzhan go byed //
translated: By means of direct perception, inference, and apparent.üîΩOne can understand oneself

original: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ltar snang bcas pas bdag rig byed //
analyzed: mngon sum dang ni rjes su dpag / ltar snang bcas pas bdag rig byed //
translated: By means of direct perception, inference, and apparent.

original: 'dir 'di skad ces pa bstan bcos rnams kyi don kun las btus pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir 'di skad ces pa bstan bcos rnams kyi don kun las btus pa yin la /
translated: Here, this is taught: This is the compendium of the meaning of the treatises.

original: de la rnam gzhag la sogs pa tshig rnams sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de la rnam gzhag la sogs pa tshig rnams sgrub par byed de /
translated: There, the words such as arrangement are the proofs.

original: phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / de rnams du mar dbye yang phyir rgol rnams 'dris pa'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir mngon par ston to //üîΩ'dir bsgrub bya'i mtshan @89a * //
analyzed: phyogs dang / gtan tshigs dang / de rnams du mar dbye yang phyir rgol rnams 'dris pa'i don ma rtogs pa'i phyir mngon par ston to // 'dir bsgrub bya'i mtshan @89a * //
translated: Although the positions, reasons, and their divisions are many, they are demonstrated for the sake of the opponents who do not understand the meaning of the familiar.

original: nyid ni sgrub pa'i chos can la chos kyi khyad par sgrub par byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyid ni sgrub pa'i chos can la chos kyi khyad par sgrub par byed pa ste /
translated: Here, the definition of the probandum is that which proves a particular property of the subject of the proof.

original: rang gis bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa 'di ni bsgrub bya yin no /
analyzed: rang gis bsgrub par bya bar 'dod pa 'di ni bsgrub bya yin no /
translated: This is what is to be established.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni tshul gsum tshang ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni tshul gsum tshang ba'o //
translated: The definition of a reason is the complete three modes.

original: tshul gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshul gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three modes?

original: phyogs kyi chos kyi ltos bzhi la yod pa dang / mthun phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun phyogs la med pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos kyi ltos bzhi la yod pa dang / mthun phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun phyogs la med pa'o //
translated: The property of the subject, the forward pervasion, and the counter pervasion.

original: mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: mthun phyogs mi mthun phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the similar class and what is the dissimilar class?

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis mthun pa ni mthun phyogs su brjod do //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis mthun pa ni mthun phyogs su brjod do //
translated: That which is similar by virtue of the generality of the property of the subject is called the similar class.

original: dper na mi rtag pa sgrub pa la bum pa la sogs pa'ang mi rtag pa yin pas mthun phyogs yin no //
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa sgrub pa la bum pa la sogs pa'ang mi rtag pa yin pas mthun phyogs yin no //
translated: For example, in the proof of sound as impermanent, a vase and so on are similar classes because they are impermanent.

original: mi mthun phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis don mthun pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi spyis don mthun pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The dissimilar class is that which is not similar by virtue of the generality of the property of the subject.

original: dper na gang rtag pa yin pa de byas pa ma yin pas khyab nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gang rtag pa yin pa de byas pa ma yin pas khyab nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the proof of sound as impermanent, whatever is permanent is necessarily not produced, like space and so on.

original: 'di dag byas pa nyid dam brtsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / phyogs chos yin la mthun phyogs la yod par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag byas pa nyid dam brtsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / phyogs chos yin la mthun phyogs la yod par nges pa yin no //
translated: The evidence is a property of the similar class, and it is ascertained to be present in the similar class.

original: mi mthun phyogs la med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs la med pa yin te /
translated: It is absent in the dissimilar class.

original: mi rtag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The evidence is impermanence.

original: dpe yang gnyis su yod de /
analyzed: dpe yang gnyis su yod de /
translated: There are two kinds of examples.

original: dang po chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / gnyis pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: dang po chos mthun pa'i dpe dang / gnyis pa chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The first is the example of similarity, and the second is the example of dissimilarity.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni don gang yin pa de la gtan tshigs su mthun phyogs la yod pa ste /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe ni don gang yin pa de la gtan tshigs su mthun phyogs la yod pa ste /
translated: The example of similarity is that which is similar to the evidence in the object to be understood.

original: dper na byas pa de mi rtag par mthong ste bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na byas pa de mi rtag par mthong ste bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the evidence is seen to be impermanent, like a pot and so on.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub bya'i don med pa gang yin pa de la gtan tshigs yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bstan pa'o//
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub bya'i don med pa gang yin pa de la gtan tshigs yod pa ni ma yin te zhes bstan pa'o//
translated: The example of dissimilarity is that which is taught to be absent in the object to be understood, where the evidence is not present.

original: dper na gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, whatever is permanent is seen to be not produced, like space and so on.

original: 'dir tha snyad du mi rtag pa'i sgra ni rtag pa ma yin par mtshon rung yin pa dang / byas pa'i sgra ni ma byas pa ma yin par mtshon rung yin la /
analyzed: 'dir tha snyad du mi rtag pa'i sgra ni rtag pa ma yin par mtshon rung yin pa dang / byas pa'i sgra ni ma byas pa ma yin par mtshon rung yin la /
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is suitable to indicate that it is not permanent, and the term ‚Äúproduced‚Äù is suitable to indicate that it is not unproduced.

original: med pa zhes brjod pa'i sgras yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: med pa zhes brjod pa'i sgras yod pa ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The term ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù indicates that it is not existent.

original: 'di skad du du mar brjod pa de dag phyir rgol rnams go bar ston la sgrub par byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad du du mar brjod pa de dag phyir rgol rnams go bar ston la sgrub par byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: In this way, the many expressions are said to be proofs that teach the opponents to understand.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa ni dam bca' ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa ni dam bca' ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: For example, ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù is the thesis.

original: byas pa'i phyir ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is produced‚Äù is the reason.

original: gang byas pa de mi rtag par mthong ste @89b bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩmthun phyogs su brjod la yod pa'i rjes 'gro yin no //
analyzed: gang byas pa de mi rtag par mthong ste @89b bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no // mthun phyogs su brjod la yod pa'i rjes 'gro yin no //
translated: Whatever is produced is seen to be impermanent, like a pot and so on.üîΩThe presence of the reason in the subject is stated by ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is seen to be impermanent.‚Äù

original: gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: gang rtag pa de byas pa ma yin par mthong ste nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: Whatever is permanent is seen to be unproduced, like space.üîΩThe pervasion is stated by ‚ÄúWhatever is permanent is seen to be unproduced.‚Äù

original: ldog par brjod la ya gyal gsum po ni zhes sgrub par byed pa yang dag go //
analyzed: ldog par brjod la ya gyal gsum po ni zhes sgrub par byed pa yang dag go //
translated: The three modes are stated by ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is seen to be impermanent, like a pot and so on.‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya bar 'dod kyang mngon sum la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsgrub bya ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bar 'dod kyang mngon sum la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsgrub bya ltar snang ngo //
translated: Even though one wishes to establish something, it is like a probandum because it is eliminated by perception and so on.

original: mngon sum gyis bsal ba dang / rjes dpag gis bsal ba dang / yid ches pas bsal ba dang / grags pas bsal ba dang / rang tshig gis bsal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub bya'i chos can ma grub pa dang /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis bsal ba dang / rjes dpag gis bsal ba dang / yid ches pas bsal ba dang / grags pas bsal ba dang / rang tshig gis bsal ba dang / bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub bya'i chos can ma grub pa dang /
translated: Elimination by perception, elimination by inference, elimination by testimony, elimination by renown, elimination by one's own words, the probandum not being established, the locus of the probandum not being established,

original: gnyis ka ma grub pa dang / phan tshun grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma grub pa dang / phan tshun grub pa'o //
translated: both not being established, and mutual establishment.

original: de la mngon sum gyis bsal ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis bsal ba ni /
translated: Among those, elimination by perception is

original: dper na sgra mnyan bya ma yin par brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra mnyan bya ma yin par brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: like saying sound is not audible.

original: rjes dpag gis bsal ba ni dper na bum pa la sogs pa rtag par brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rjes dpag gis bsal ba ni dper na bum pa la sogs pa rtag par brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Elimination by inference is like saying a pot and so on are permanent.

original: yid ches pas bsal ba ni dper na bye brag pa sgra rtag par bsgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid ches pas bsal ba ni dper na bye brag pa sgra rtag par bsgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: Elimination by testimony is like the Vai≈õe·π£ikas proving that sound is permanent.

original: grags pas bsal ba ni dper na ri bong can zla ba ma yin te yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'am /
analyzed: grags pas bsal ba ni dper na ri bong can zla ba ma yin te yod pa'i phyir zhes pa'am /
translated: Elimination by renown is like saying the rabbit-bearer is not the moon because it exists,üîΩor like saying the moon is not the rabbit-bearer because it is the moon.

original: gzhan yang mi'i thod pa gtsang ba yin te sems can gyi cha shas yin pa'i phyir dung chos bzhin zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi'i thod pa gtsang ba yin te sems can gyi cha shas yin pa'i phyir dung chos bzhin zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Moreover, it is said that the human skull is pure because it is a part of a sentient being, like a conch shell.

original: rang tshig gis bsal ba ni dper na bdag gi ma mo gsham yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang tshig gis bsal ba ni dper na bdag gi ma mo gsham yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Self-contradictory is, for example, saying, ‚ÄúMy mother is barren.‚Äù

original: chos ma grub pa ni dper na sangs rgyas pa rnam grangs can pa la sgra 'jig yod sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ma grub pa ni dper na sangs rgyas pa rnam grangs can pa la sgra 'jig yod sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: Unestablished fact is, for example, a Buddhist proving to a Sa·πÉkhya that sound is impermanent.

original: chos can ma grub pa ni dper na grangs can pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni sems pa yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos can ma grub pa ni dper na grangs can pas sangs rgyas pa la bdag ni sems pa yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Unestablished subject is, for example, a Sa·πÉkhya saying to a Buddhist, ‚ÄúThe self is the thinker.‚Äù

original: gnyis ka ma grub pa ni dper na bye brag pas sangs rgyas pa las bdag ni rgyu rkyen 'dus shing rten cing 'brel par sbyor ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka ma grub pa ni dper na bye brag pas sangs rgyas pa las bdag ni rgyu rkyen 'dus shing rten cing 'brel par sbyor ba'i byed pa po yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Both unestablished is, for example, a Vai≈õe·π£ika saying to a Buddhist, ‚ÄúThe self is the agent that combines causes and conditions and is the support of the union.‚Äù

original: phan tshun grub pa ni dper na sgra ni mnyan bya yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: phan tshun grub pa ni dper na sgra ni mnyan bya yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: Mutually exclusive is, for example, saying, ‚ÄúSound is audible.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du du mar brjod pa dag ngo bo gsal ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par nus kyang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i skyon yin pas ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: 'di skad du du mar brjod pa dag ngo bo gsal ba'i phyir dang / bsgrub mi dgos pa'i phyir dang / bsgrub par nus kyang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir bsgrub bya'i skyon yin pas ltar snang ngo //
translated: It is said that these are fallacious because they are the faults of the probandum, since they are many, since they are not established, and since even if they could be established, they are not the result.

original: bsgrub bya ltar snang bstan zin to //
analyzed: bsgrub bya ltar snang bstan zin to //
translated: The fallacious probandum has been explained.

original: da ni gtan tshigs ltar snang bshad par bya'o//
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs ltar snang bshad par bya'o//
translated: Now the fallacious reason will be explained.

original: @90a * // ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'gal ba 'di rnams gtan tshigs ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: @90a * // ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'gal ba 'di rnams gtan tshigs ltar snang ngo //
translated: The fallacious reason is the unestablished, the indefinite, and the contradictory.

original: ma grub pa'ang bzhi yod de /
analyzed: ma grub pa'ang bzhi yod de /
translated: There are four kinds of unestablished:

original: gnyis ka la ma grub pa dang / gang rung gcig la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za nas ma grub pa dang // gzhi ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la ma grub pa dang / gang rung gcig la ma grub pa dang / the tshom za nas ma grub pa dang // gzhi ma grub pa'o //
translated: the unestablished in both, the unestablished in one, the unestablished due to doubt, and the unestablished due to the nonestablishment of the locus.

original: gnyis ka la ma grub pa ni dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa la ming gi gzung bya nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bkod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la ma grub pa ni dper na sgra mi rtag par sgrub pa la ming gi gzung bya nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bkod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The unestablished in both is, for example, positing ‚Äúbecause of being the object held by a name‚Äù as a reason in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: gang rung gcig la ma grub pa ni sgra mngon par gsal bar 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas byas pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang rung gcig la ma grub pa ni sgra mngon par gsal bar 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas byas pa'i phyir zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The unestablished as one is, for example, when one says, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced,‚Äù and someone replies, ‚ÄúIt is not established for one of ourselves, because of the treatise that asserts that sound is manifest.‚Äù

original: the tshom za nas ma grub pa ni the tshom za pa'i rlangs pa la sogs pa skya bo'i rdzas kyi rtags mthong ba'i tshe 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa'i me yod ces sgrub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: the tshom za nas ma grub pa ni the tshom za pa'i rlangs pa la sogs pa skya bo'i rdzas kyi rtags mthong ba'i tshe 'byung ba chen po 'dus pa'i me yod ces sgrub pa lta bu'o //
translated: The unestablished as doubt is, for example, when one infers the existence of fire in the collection of the great elements from the perception of the sign, the white vapor and so on, and someone replies, ‚ÄúIt is not established, because one doubts whether it is smoke or mist.‚Äù

original: gzhi ma grub pa ni nam mkha' dngos por yod de yon tan rten pa'i phyir zhes brjod na //
analyzed: gzhi ma grub pa ni nam mkha' dngos por yod de yon tan rten pa'i phyir zhes brjod na //
translated: The unestablished as basis is, for example, when one says, ‚ÄúSpace exists as a thing, because it is the basis of a quality,‚Äù

original: nam mkha' med par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas gzhi ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' med par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas gzhi ma grub pa'o //
translated: and someone replies, ‚ÄúIt is not established as a basis, because of the treatise that asserts that space does not exist.‚Äù

original: ma nges pa la drug yod de /
analyzed: ma nges pa la drug yod de /
translated: There are six kinds of indefinite.

original: thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mi mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa dang / mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa dang / gnyis ka'i phyogs re la 'jug pa dang /üîΩ'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba'o //üîΩda ni thun mong ba ni dper na sgra rtag pa yin te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rtag mi rtag gi phyogs dag la thun mong du 'jug pa'i phyir te /üîΩma nges pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ba dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang / mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mi mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa dang / mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa dang / gnyis ka'i phyogs re la 'jug pa dang / 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba'o // da ni thun mong ba ni dper na sgra rtag pa yin te gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir rtag mi rtag gi phyogs dag la thun mong du 'jug pa'i phyir te / ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: 1. common, 2. uncommon, 3. operating on one part of the concordant side but pervading the discordant side, 4. operating on one part of the discordant side but pervading the concordant side, 5. operating on one part of each,üîΩand 6. nonerroneous with regard to the contradictory.üîΩNow, the common is, for example, ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is an object of comprehension,‚Äù for it operates commonly on the sides of permanent and impermanent.üîΩIt is an uncertain reason.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di ltar gzhal bya nyid yin pa'i rtags ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩsgra mi rtag pa nyid dam gzhal bya nyid yin pa'i rtags ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin sgra rtag pa nyid du dogs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhal bya nyid yin pa'i rtags ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //üîΩsgra mi rtag pa nyid dam gzhal bya nyid yin pa'i rtags ni nam mkha' la sogs pa bzhin sgra rtag pa nyid du dogs pas so //
translated: 1. common, 2. uncommon, 3. operating on one part of the concordant side and pervading the discordant side, 4. operating on one part of the discordant side and pervading the concordant side, 5. operating on one part of each of the two sides, 6. operating on the whole of each of the two sides, 7. operating on the whole of the concordant side and on one part of the discordant side, 8. operating on the whole of the concord

original: thun mong ma yin par brjod pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir te zhes brjod pa'i tshe rtag mi rtag phyogs dag la rtag mi rtag las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'dis the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin par brjod pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir te zhes brjod pa'i tshe rtag mi rtag phyogs dag la rtag mi rtag las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'dis the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The uncommon is, for example, when one says, ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is audible,‚Äù then this reason will be inconclusive because there is no third possibility other than permanent and impermanent with respect to the positions of permanent and impermanent.

original: mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mi mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa ni dper na sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba na mi yin te mi rtag pa nyid yin @90b pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mi mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa ni dper na sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung ba na mi yin te mi rtag pa nyid yin @90b pa'i phyir te /
translated: The second is, for example, when sound is produced immediately after effort, it is a nonpermanent thing because it is impermanent.

original: 'dir bsgrub bya'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsgrub bya'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here the property of the subject, ‚Äúis not produced immediately after effort,‚Äù is not the predicate of the probandum.

original: 'di mthun phyogs glog dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di mthun phyogs glog dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The concordant side is lightning, space, and so on.

original: mi rtag pa de nyid ni glog la sogs pa la yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa la med do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa de nyid ni glog la sogs pa la yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa la med do //
translated: Impermanence exists in lightning and so on but does not exist in space and so on.

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa bsgrub bya'i chos de ni mi mthun phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la gtan tshigs khyab par yod la glog dang bum pa la sogs pa mthun chos byas na ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa bsgrub bya'i chos de ni mi mthun phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la gtan tshigs khyab par yod la glog dang bum pa la sogs pa mthun chos byas na ma nges pa ste /
translated: The predicate of the proposition is not something that occurs immediately after exertion, but the reason pervades the discordant side, such as a pot. If lightning and a pot are similar instances, it is indefinite.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid dam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni bum pa la sogs pa bzhin brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid dam /
translated: Impermanence is like a pot, which occurs immediately after exertion.

original: mi rtag pa ni glog la sogs pa bzhin brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid du dogs pas so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa ni glog la sogs pa bzhin brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba ma yin pa nyid du dogs pas so //
translated: Or impermanence is like lightning, which does not occur immediately after exertion.

original: mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa ni dper na sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung bar bsgrub pa la mi rtag pa'i phyir te brjod pa'i tshe bsgrub bya'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba 'di mthun phyogs bum pa
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la 'jug la mthun phyogs la khyab par 'jug pa ni dper na sgra brtsal ma thag tu byung bar bsgrub pa la mi rtag pa'i phyir te brjod pa'i tshe bsgrub bya'i chos brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba 'di mthun phyogs bum pa
translated: The reason is applied to one part of the discordant side but pervades the similar side. For example, when proving that sound occurs immediately after exertion because it is impermanent, the predicate of the proposition is something that occurs immediately after exertion. The similar side is a pot.

original: la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid khyab par yod la glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa la mi rtag pa nyid khyab par yod la glog dang nam mkha' la sogs pa ni mi mthun phyogs yin te /
translated: and so on, impermanence pervades it, but lightning, space and so on are discordant classes.

original: phyogs gcig glog la sogs pa la yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs gcig la med pas de yang sngar bzhin ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs gcig glog la sogs pa la yod la nam mkha' la sogs pa phyogs gcig la med pas de yang sngar bzhin ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Since impermanence exists in one part, lightning and so on, but does not exist in another part, space and so on, it is also indefinite, as before.

original: gnyis ka'i phyogs re la 'jug pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i phyogs re la 'jug pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The application of a reason to only one part of the similar class and dissimilar class is, for example, the argument that sound is permanent because it is unobstructing.

original: 'dir rtag par sgrub pa na mthun phyogs nam mkha' dang rdul phran la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rtag par sgrub pa na mthun phyogs nam mkha' dang rdul phran la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, when proving sound to be permanent, space, atoms and so on are the similar class.

original: gtan tshigs thogs pa med pa de nam mkha' la sogs pa la 'jug la rdul phran la mi 'jug go //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thogs pa med pa de nam mkha' la sogs pa la 'jug la rdul phran la mi 'jug go //
translated: The reason, unobstructing, applies to space and so on, but it does not apply to atoms.

original: mi mthun phyogs bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthun phyogs bum pa dang bde ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Pots, pleasure and so on are the dissimilar class.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la yod la bum pa la sogs pa la yod pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la yod la bum pa la sogs pa la yod pa ni ma yin no /
translated: It exists in pleasure and so on, but it does not exist in pots and so on.

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang nam mkha' la dpe mthun par byas pa de'ang ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang nam mkha' la dpe mthun par byas pa de'ang ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though pleasure and space are made to be similar examples, it is indefinite.

original: 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa yin te bsgrub bya ni byas pa'i phyir te dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
analyzed: 'gal ba la mi 'khrul ba ni dper na sgra ni mi rtag pa yin te bsgrub bya ni byas pa'i phyir te dper na bum pa la sogs pa bzhin /
translated: Non-erroneous with respect to contradiction is, for example, sound is impermanent because of being produced, like a pot, etc.

original: sgra sgrub pa de rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir te sgra nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: sgra sgrub pa de rtag ste mnyan bya yin pa'i phyir te sgra nyid bzhin no //
translated: The proof of sound is permanent because of being audible, like sound itself.

original: de gnyis ka la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ka la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Because of doubt about both, it is uncertain.

original: 'gal ba la bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba la bzhi ste /
translated: There are four with respect to contradiction:

original: chos kyi ngo bo dang / @91a * //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo dang / @91a * //
translated: the reason contradictory to the nature of the predicate,

original: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos can rang ldog dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos can gyi 'khrul pa dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos can rang ldog dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / chos can gyi 'khrul pa dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs so //
translated: the reason contradictory to the nature of the subject, the reason contradictory to the specific predicate, and the reason contradictory to the error of the subject.

original: 'dir chos kyi ngo bo dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te byas pa'i phyir dang / yang na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes brjod na gtan tshigs 'di mi mthun phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir chos kyi ngo bo dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na sgra ni rtag pa yin te byas pa'i phyir dang / yang na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir zhes brjod na gtan tshigs 'di mi mthun phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Here, a reason that contradicts the nature of the phenomenon is, for example, saying, ‚ÄúSound is permanent because it is produced‚Äù or ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced.‚Äù

original: chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa yin te /
analyzed: chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed pa yin te /
translated: A reason that contradicts a particular quality of the phenomenon is, for example, saying, ‚ÄúThe eye and so on are for the benefit of another.

original: 'dus shing bsags pa'i phyir te mal cha la sogs pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: 'dus shing bsags pa'i phyir te mal cha la sogs pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: Because they are a collection and a composite, like a bed and so on.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs 'dis mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed par sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'dis mig la sogs pa gzhan gyi don byed par sgrub pa'am /
translated: This reason proves that the eye and so on are for the benefit of another.

original: gzhan du na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos kyi khyad par dang 'gal ba sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it proves the opposite of the particular quality of the phenomenon to be proven.

original: mal cha la sogs pa yang 'dus shing bsags pa yin te gzhan gyi longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mal cha la sogs pa yang 'dus shing bsags pa yin te gzhan gyi longs spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a bed and so on are also a collection and a composite, they are for the benefit of another.

original: chos can gyi ngo bo dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na yod pa nyid ni rdzas dang yon tan las ma yin te /
analyzed: chos can gyi ngo bo dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na yod pa nyid ni rdzas dang yon tan las ma yin te /
translated: A reason that contradicts the nature of the subject is, for example, if one says, Existence is not substance and quality

original: rdzas gcig yod pa'i phyir dang / yon tan dang las yod pa'i phyir bye brag bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: rdzas gcig yod pa'i phyir dang / yon tan dang las yod pa'i phyir bye brag bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: because substance is one and because quality and action exist, like a particular.

original: gtan tshigs 'di rdzas ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di rdzas ma yin pa sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: This reason would prove that it is not substance,

original: gzhan du na yod pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na yod pa ma yin pa sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: or else it would prove that it does not exist.

original: de gnyis ka nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ka nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are ascertained.üîΩA reason that contradicts the specific property of the subject is, for example, if the previous reason proves the specific property of the subject, existence, and

original: chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na sngar gyi gtan tshigs de nyid bsgrub bya'i chos can khyad par yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa dang / gzhan du na 'di dang 'gal ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par dang 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ni dper na sngar gyi gtan tshigs de nyid bsgrub bya'i chos can khyad par yod pa nyid sgrub par byed pa dang / gzhan du na 'di dang 'gal ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod pa nyid ma yin par sgrub par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: or else it would prove the opposite, that existence does not exist,

original: rdzas la sogs pa 'gog bzhin du gnyis ka nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas la sogs pa 'gog bzhin du gnyis ka nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because both are ascertained while refuting substance and so on.

original: gtan tshigs ltar snang bshad zin to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltar snang bshad zin to //
translated: We have finished explaining the fallacious reasons.

original: da ni dpe ltar snang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni dpe ltar snang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we will discuss the fallacious examples.

original: chos mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang la'ang lnga yod de /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang la'ang lnga yod de /
translated: There are five kinds of fallacious examples that are similar to the thesis:

original: sgrub byed chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub bya chos ma grub pa dang / gnyis ka ma grub pa dang / ma sbyar ba dang / phyin ci log tu sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed chos ma grub pa dang / bsgrub bya chos ma grub pa dang / gnyis ka ma grub pa dang / ma sbyar ba dang / phyin ci log tu sbyor ba'o //
translated: the unestablished reason, the unestablished thesis, the unestablished reason and thesis, the non-application, and the perverse application.

original: chos mi @91b mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang la yang lnga yod de /
analyzed: chos mi @91b mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang la yang lnga yod de /
translated: There are five kinds of fallacious examples that are dissimilar to the thesis:

original: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa med pa dang / sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa dang / gnyis ka ldog pa med pa dang / ldog pa ma bstan pa dang / ldog pa phyin ci log tu sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ldog pa med pa dang / sgrub par byed pa ldog pa med pa dang / gnyis ka ldog pa med pa dang / ldog pa ma bstan pa dang / ldog pa phyin ci log tu sbyar ba'o //
translated: the non-exclusion of the probandum, the non-exclusion of the reason, the non-exclusion of both, the non-teaching of the exclusion, and the perverse teaching of the exclusion.

original: sgrub byed chos ma grub pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub byed chos ma grub pa ni dper na sgra rtag ste thogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The unestablished reason is like the following argument: Sound is permanent because it is without obstruction.

original: gang thogs pa med pa ste rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: gang thogs pa med pa ste rtag par mthong ste /
translated: Whatever is without obstruction is seen to be permanent,

original: rdul phra rab bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: rdul phra rab bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: like an atom.

original: ci'i phyir rdul phra rab la bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid yin la sgrub byed kyi chos thogs pa med pa ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rdul phra rab la bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa nyid yin la sgrub byed kyi chos thogs pa med pa ma grub pa ste /
translated: Why? Because the property to be established, permanence, is not established for the subtle particle, and the proving property, being unimpeded, is not established.

original: rdul phra rab rnams thogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams thogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because subtle particles are impeded.

original: bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa ni dper na tshor ba bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i chos ma grub pa ni dper na tshor ba bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said that the property to be established is not established, like feeling,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i chos thogs pa med pa yod kyang bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid med de /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i chos thogs pa med pa yod kyang bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid med de /
translated: although the proving property, being unimpeded, exists, the property to be established, permanence, does not exist.

original: tshor ba thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad mi rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because all feelings are impermanent.

original: gnyis ka ma grub pa ni de la'ang gnyis yod de /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma grub pa ni de la'ang gnyis yod de /
translated: The nonestablishment of both has two types:

original: yod pa dang / med pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa'o //
translated: existence and nonexistence.

original: gal te bum pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te bum pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said to be like a pot,

original: yod pa la gnyis ka ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa la gnyis ka ma grub pa'o //
translated: the nonestablishment of both is in regard to existence.

original: gal te nam mkha' bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said to be like space,

original: nam mkha' med par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas med pa la gnyis ka ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' med par 'dod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas med pa la gnyis ka ma grub pa'o //
translated: the nonestablishment of both is in regard to nonexistence, in reliance on a treatise that asserts space to be nonexistent.

original: ma sbyar ba ni don de la dpe sbyor ba gtan med pas bum pa la sogs pa la sgrub byed dang bsgrub bya'i chos gnyis 'ba' zhig kho na ston pa ste dper na bum pa la byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma sbyar ba ni don de la dpe sbyor ba gtan med pas bum pa la sogs pa la sgrub byed dang bsgrub bya'i chos gnyis 'ba' zhig kho na ston pa ste dper na bum pa la byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The unassociated is the mere indication of the two, the property to be established and the property of the thesis, such as a pot, without any example being applied to that meaning. For example, it is like stating that a pot is produced and impermanent.

original: phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ni gang byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yin te zhes brjod par bya ba las mi rtag pa thams cad byas pa yin zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ni gang byas pa thams cad mi rtag pa nyid yin te zhes brjod par bya ba las mi rtag pa thams cad byas pa yin zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: The wrongly associated is when one says that all that is produced is impermanent, but one says that all that is impermanent is produced.

original: de rnams ni mthun dpe ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: de rnams ni mthun dpe ltar snang ngo //
translated: These are the apparent similar instances.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ldog pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ltar snang ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ldog pa med pa yin te /
translated: The apparent dissimilar instances are when the negation of the property of the thesis is not reversed.

original: re zhig dper na mi rtag pa rnams ni thogs bcas mthong ba min te rdul phra rab bzhin no //
analyzed: re zhig dper na mi rtag pa rnams ni thogs bcas mthong ba min te rdul phra rab bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúThe obstructed are not seen to be impermanent, like subtle particles.‚Äù

original: rdul phra rab ni bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid mi ldog pa yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab ni bsgrub bya'i chos rtag pa nyid mi ldog pa yin te /
translated: The subtle particles do not reverse the negation of the property of the thesis, permanence.

original: de ma yin pa'i rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rdul phra rab rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason is not contradictory because the other particles are permanent.

original: sgrub byed de'i chos ni thogs pa med do //
analyzed: sgrub byed de'i chos ni thogs pa med do //
translated: The property of the reason is unimpeded.üîΩFor example, like the karma of another.

original: dper na gzhan gyi las bzhin zhes bsgrub bya ldog pa la sgrub byed mi ldog pa @92a * //
analyzed: dper na gzhan gyi las bzhin zhes bsgrub bya ldog pa la sgrub byed mi ldog pa @92a * //
translated: The reason is not reversed in the predicate,

original: ste ; pha rol gyi las rnams ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ste ; pha rol gyi las rnams ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the karma of another is unimpeded.

original: gnyis ka ldog pa med pa ni yod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas nam mkha' bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gnyis ka ldog pa med pa ni yod pa'i bstan bcos la ltos nas nam mkha' bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: The non-reversal of both is like space, in dependence on the treatise on existence.üîΩSpace is not reversed in permanence and unimpededness,

original: nam mkha' ni rtag pa nyid dang / thogs pa med pa nyid mi ldog pa ste zhes nam mkha' rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rtag pa nyid dang / thogs pa med pa nyid mi ldog pa ste zhes nam mkha' rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because space is permanent,

original: thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unimpeded.

original: ldog pa bstan pa ni dper na bum pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: ldog pa bstan pa ni dper na bum pa bzhin zhes brjod na /
translated: The teaching of the reversal is like a pot, for example.

original: mi rtag pa mthong ba nyid dang / thogs bcas su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa mthong ba nyid dang / thogs bcas su mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because impermanence is seen and obstruction is seen.

original: ldog pa phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ni thogs bcas thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ldog pa phyin ci log tu sbyar ba ni thogs bcas thams cad mi rtag pa yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: The opposite is the case when one says: ‚ÄúAll that is impeded is impermanent.‚Äù

original: de ltar bsgrub bya dang / gtan tshigs dang dper brjod pa rnams ni ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub bya dang / gtan tshigs dang dper brjod pa rnams ni ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the probandum, the probans, and the example are all false.

original: sgrub byed yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgrub byed yang dag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The proof is not correct.

original: des na rang gis mngon par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: des na rang gis mngon par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should know for oneself.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma gnyis kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that there are only two kinds of valid knowledge: perception and inference.

original: 'dir mngon sum tshad ma ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir mngon sum tshad ma ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba ste /
translated: Here, perception is free from conceptual thought and is non-erroneous.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i don la tha snyad la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba so sor mngon gyur mthong bas mngon sum tshad mar brjod do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i don la tha snyad la sogs pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba so sor mngon gyur mthong bas mngon sum tshad mar brjod do //
translated: It is called perception because it is the seeing of the individual, manifest object, free from conceptual thought such as name, etc., with regard to an object such as form, etc.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni rtags rnams la ltos nas don mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma ni rtags rnams la ltos nas don mthong ba yin te /
translated: Inference is the seeing of an object in dependence on a reason.

original: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum pa'i sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni tshul gsum pa'i sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The reason has been explained as having three modes.

original: de dag rtags la brten nas don rnams dpog pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag rtags la brten nas don rnams dpog pa yin la /
translated: They infer objects on the basis of signs.

original: yang dag pa'i nges pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa dang / me yod shes pa'am mi rtag par shes pa la sogs pa ste rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar brjod do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i nges pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa dang / me yod shes pa'am mi rtag par shes pa la sogs pa ste rjes su dpag pa'i tshad mar brjod do //
translated: The knowledge that fire exists or the knowledge that something is impermanent is called inferential valid knowledge.

original: tshad ma gnyis po de la yang dag pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis po de la yang dag pa'i shes pa tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The result of valid knowledge is right knowledge.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it realizes its own character.

original: don byed nus pa'i dngos su gzhal ba'i phyir te tshad ma'ang yin no //
analyzed: don byed nus pa'i dngos su gzhal ba'i phyir te tshad ma'ang yin no //
translated: It is also valid knowledge because it evaluates an object that is able to perform a function.

original: rtog par shes pa'ang mngon sum ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: rtog par shes pa'ang mngon sum ltar snang ngo //
translated: Conceptual knowledge is like direct perception.

original: shes pa rnams kyi bum pa la sogs pa rtog pa skyes pa de mngon sum ltar snang yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyi bum pa la sogs pa rtog pa skyes pa de mngon sum ltar snang yin te /
translated: The arising of a conceptual consciousness such as the knowledge of a pot is like direct perception.

original: shes pa de la don rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa de la don rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object does not appear to that consciousness as its own character.

original: gal te gtan tshigs ltar snang sngon du song ba la sogs pa de'i rjes su don lta bur snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa de rjes dpag tshad ma'i @92b ltar snang ste /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs ltar snang sngon du song ba la sogs pa de'i rjes su don lta bur snang ba'i shes pa skyes pa de rjes dpag tshad ma'i @92b ltar snang ste /
translated: If a cognition arises that appears to be about an object after a prior appearance of a reason, that is a pseudo-inference.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang du ma rtags su bzung nas don lta bur snang ba dpag pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de rnams rjes dpag tshad ma'i ltar snang ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin du gtan tshigs ltar snang du ma rtags su bzung nas don lta bur snang ba dpag pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de rnams rjes dpag tshad ma'i ltar snang ste /
translated: As explained above, if a reason that is a pseudo-reason is taken as a sign, the cognition that arises from inferring what appears to be the object is a pseudo-inference.

original: yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a correct understanding.

original: de nas gal te sgrub par byed pa po'i skyon rnams yang dag rjod par byed pa ni sun 'byin yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: de nas gal te sgrub par byed pa po'i skyon rnams yang dag rjod par byed pa ni sun 'byin yang dag pa'o //
translated: If the faults of the proponent are correctly stated, that is correct refutation.üîΩThe faults of the proponent are taught to be the following:üîΩthe incompleteness of the proponent‚Äôs proof,üîΩthe fault of the probandum,üîΩthe unestablished reason,üîΩthe uncertain reason,

original: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba nyid dang / bsgrub bya'i skyon nyid dang / ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs dang / 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams kyi gtan tshigs gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma tshang ba nyid dang / bsgrub bya'i skyon nyid dang / ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs dang / ma nges pa'i gtan tshigs dang / 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs dang / dpe rnams kyi gtan tshigs gsal bar bstan te /
translated: the contradictory reason,üîΩand the examples.

original: phyir rgol gyi 'dri ba rnams la legs par khong du chud par byed pas sun 'byin yang dag go //
analyzed: phyir rgol gyi 'dri ba rnams la legs par khong du chud par byed pas sun 'byin yang dag go //
translated: It is a correct refutation because it thoroughly comprehends the opponent‚Äôs questions.

original: gal te sgrub byed kyi skyon rnams gsal bar mi brjod pa'am /
analyzed: gal te sgrub byed kyi skyon rnams gsal bar mi brjod pa'am /
translated: If the faults of the proof are not clearly stated,

original: skyon ma yin pa ni sun 'byin ltar snang ste /üîΩsgrub byed yan lag tshang ba la ma tshang bar brjod pa nyid dang / bsgrub bya skyon med pa la skyon can yin par brjod pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa la dpe grub pa ni ma yin par brjod pa dang / gtan tshigs nges pa la ma nges par brjod pa dang /
analyzed: skyon ma yin pa ni sun 'byin ltar snang ste / sgrub byed yan lag tshang ba la ma tshang bar brjod pa nyid dang / bsgrub bya skyon med pa la skyon can yin par brjod pa dang / gtan tshigs sgrub pa la dpe grub pa ni ma yin par brjod pa dang / gtan tshigs nges pa la ma nges par brjod pa dang /
translated: or if they are not faults, it is a pseudo-refutation.üîΩIt is a pseudo-refutation to say that the proof is incomplete when it is complete, to say that the probandum is faulty when it is not, to say that the example is not established when it is established, to say that the reason is not ascertained when it is ascertained,

original: gtan tshigs ma 'gal ba la 'gal bar brjod pa dang / dpe skyon can ma yin pa la dpe skyon can yin par brjod pa dang / 'di ltar thams cad sun 'byin ltar snang ngo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma 'gal ba la 'gal bar brjod pa dang / dpe skyon can ma yin pa la dpe skyon can yin par brjod pa dang / 'di ltar thams cad sun 'byin ltar snang ngo //
translated: to say that the reason is contradictory when it is non-contradictory, to say that the example is faulty when it is not faulty, and so on. All of these are pseudo-refutations.

original: de dag gzhan gyi grub mtha' la skyon rnams gsal bar bstan mi nus pa'i phyir skyon ma yin par brjod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gzhan gyi grub mtha' la skyon rnams gsal bar bstan mi nus pa'i phyir skyon ma yin par brjod pa nyid do //
translated: Because they are unable to clearly demonstrate the faults in the tenets of others, they are called ‚Äúfaults.‚Äù

original: don 'di re zhig gzhag go //
analyzed: don 'di re zhig gzhag go //
translated: Let us leave this topic for the time being.

original: tshig don cung zad bshad pa 'di //
analyzed: tshig don cung zad bshad pa 'di //
translated: This brief explanation of the meaning of the words

original: thog mar sgrub pa'i phyogs tsam yin //üîΩde dag tshul dang tshul min yang //
analyzed: thog mar sgrub pa'i phyogs tsam yin // de dag tshul dang tshul min yang //
translated: is merely a beginning, a mere fraction of the proof.

original: mchog gi gzhan du shes par bya //
analyzed: mchog gi gzhan du shes par bya //
translated: The supreme should be understood elsewhereüîΩwith regard to their proper and improper ways.

original: tshad ma'i bstan bcos rig pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: tshad ma'i bstan bcos rig pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba slob dpon chen po phyogs kyi glang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the treatise on valid knowledge called ‚ÄúEntering into Logic‚Äù composed by the great master DignƒÅga.

original: // / rgya gar las rgya'i lo ts'a ba thang sam tsang gis bsgyur cing slad kyis rgya'i dge bshes sing gyang jus dang / bod kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen ston gzhon gyis bod skad du bsgyur zhing /
analyzed: // / rgya gar las rgya'i lo ts'a ba thang sam tsang gis bsgyur cing slad kyis rgya'i dge bshes sing gyang jus dang / bod kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen ston gzhon gyis bod skad du bsgyur zhing /
translated: It was translated from Chinese into Tibetan by the Chinese translator Thang-sam-tsang and later by the Chinese gesh√© Sing-gyang-ju and the Tibetan gesh√© Sh√∂n-nu-drak.

original: phyis gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa las rab tu byung ba rgya nag chen po'i lta'i btsun pa chos kyi rin chen gyis /
analyzed: phyis gzhi thams cad yod par smra ba'i sde pa las rab tu byung ba rgya nag chen po'i lta'i btsun pa chos kyi rin chen gyis /
translated: Later, the monk Dharmaratna of the Great China, who had gone forth in the Sarvastivada school,

original: dpal ldan sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du rgya'i dpe dang bod kyi dpe gnyis po legs par gtugs shing bcos te dag par bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: dpal ldan sa skya'i gtsug lag khang du rgya'i dpe dang bod kyi dpe gnyis po legs par gtugs shing bcos te dag par bsgyur ba'o /
translated: carefully compared the Chinese and Tibetan texts at the glorious Sakya temple, corrected them, and translated them purely.

original: // / @93a * //  rgya'i dpe la rigs pa la 'jug pa zhes snang /
analyzed: // / @93a * //  rgya'i dpe la rigs pa la 'jug pa zhes snang /
translated: In the Chinese text, it appears as Entering into Reasoning.

original: deng sang bod rnams rigs pa'i sgo zhes grags so//
analyzed: deng sang bod rnams rigs pa'i sgo zhes grags so//
translated: Nowadays Tibetans know it as The Door of Reasoning.
